channel.title: swift on Misty
channel.description: Recent content in swift on Misty

item.title: 100 Days of SwiftUI
item.description: Has been learning Swift for the last couple of days. Day 9 of 100 Days of SwiftUI. Today, when trying to solve the quiz of finding the square root of a given number (without using the built-in sqrt()), I learned the binary search algorithm in Swift. The core codes: var low = 1 var high = number var result = 0 while low <= high { let mid = (low + high) / 2 if mid * mid == number { return mid } else if mid * mid < number { low = mid + 1 result = mid } else { high = mid - 1 } } It’s kind of interesting, so I tried to write the binary search in Swift (finding the index of a given target in a given array).
